name: execute-write-command
description:
Execute a write CLI command (create, update, delete, add, remove). Use discover-commands with category='write' first.

Common operations:
- Create entities: person create, company create, opportunity create
- Add to lists: list-entry add --list-id <id> --entity-id <id>
- Log interactions: interaction create --type meeting --participants <id>
- Update list entry fields: entry field "<list>" <entryId> --set <field> <value>

Examples:
- person create --first-name John --last-name Doe --emails john@example.com
- interaction create --type meeting --direction outgoing --participants 123
- note create --entity-id 456 --content 'Meeting notes here'
- entry field "Dealflow" 123 --set Status "Active"

Destructive commands (delete, remove) require confirm=true.

command.description: CLI command path (e.g., 'person create', 'list-entry add', 'interaction create'). Use discover-commands with category='write' to find available commands.

argv.description: Command arguments as array. Use '--flag', 'value' pairs. Example: ['--first-name', 'John', '--last-name', 'Doe', '--emails', 'john@example.com']

confirm.description: REQUIRED for destructive commands (delete, remove). Set to true to confirm the operation. Automatically appends --yes to CLI.

dryRun.description: If true, return the command that would be executed without running it. Use to verify command before execution.
